|Item_parent_short=Facial paralysis
|Rank=B
|Title=Illustration of the functional anatomy of the facial nerve
|Description=Visualise the motor, sensitive and secretory innervation of the facial nerve
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=14}}
Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

question.question: Which of the following best describes the primary function of the facial nerve?
question.option_a: Motor innervation of the muscles of facial expression
question.option_b: Sensory innervation of the anterior two-thirds of the tongue
question.option_c: Secretory innervation of the lacrimal and salivary glands
question.option_d: Motor innervation of the muscles involved in chewing
